general_advisory: Prevailing weather condition is favorable for infestation of sucking pests like aphid, jassids, whitefly, mealy bug and thrips. Apply neem bases pesticide Azadiractin (1500 ppm) @ 3ml/liter of water at initial stage to manage sucking pest infestation.

advisory: Pest Management: Blast: Current weather is favorable for blast infestation.
Nutrient Management: Apply 16kg Urea + 10kg MOP per acre in upland condition and 20 kg urea + 13kg MOP per acre in medium and low land condition at panicle initiation stage as second top dressing.
Nutrient Management: Spraying may be done with 100 g Magnesium sulphate mixed with 100 g urea in 10 liter of water in waterlogged areas to reduce leaf reddening.

Pest Management: Sucking Pests (Aphid, Jassids, Thrips, Whitefly): Application of Neem based pesticide like Neem oil@ 600 -800 ml + 200 g detergent powder per acre by mixing with 200 liters of water is advisable.
Pest Management: Leaf webber: Spray Profenophos 50% EC or Chlorpyriphos 50 % + Cypermethrin 5 % EC @ 2 ml/lit @ 2ml/lit of water.
Nutrient Management: Apply Urea  @ 25kg/ac if crop is at tasseling stage and irrigate if water is not sufficient.
Pest Management: Stem borer, FAW and banded leaf and sheath blight may appear due to present weather condition.
Brinjal: To control wilt, spray Tebuconazole 25 .9% EC @  200-ml/acre + Streptocycline @ 30g/acre at the root zone mixed with 200 liters of water.
